notes:
At dishq we are building a personalised food discovery platform which can understand user taste and recommend dishes matching to their taste taking in various factors like food data, contextual and environmental.

You’ll be challenged to create innovative solutions using data across food science, math and user data to power our recommendation engine. Also, you’ll be given sole responsibility to build data pipelines using NLP techniques to make data inwarding efficient from various unstructured data sources.

Desired Skills,

Strong knowledge in computer science fundamentals, algorithms, mathematics, linear algebra, graph theory, probability and statistics.
Hands on experience in handling text data and NLP concepts and ML libraries. Proficient in python and using libraries -- nltk, sklearn, numpy, scipy, pandas, …
Comfortable with django framework.
Comfortable with web scraping, extracting, manipulating and analyzing complex, high-volume, high-dimensionality data from varying sources.
Strong passion for data driven research for answering hard questions with data.
Ability to communicate complex quantitative analysis in a clear, precise, and actionable manner.
Having good understanding of design principles.
Passionate about startups and ability to work in fast paced environment.
Problems you will be working on

Develop appropriate text analytics to automate labelling for unstructured data from different sources.
Build analytics to measure quality of results from user interaction data.
Conceptualize and develop novel techniques to understand food data and improve personalisation algorithm.
A/B test various techniques/tunings to personalisation models.
Introduce self learning models based on various data points to improve accuracy of prediction.
Skills
Python, Machine Learning, Django, Probability & Statistics, NLP

rubric.description: The most effective interview skill is knowing how to make a case for yourself. If you don't have the experience, or even all the skills for the job, you can still demonstrate that you're a quick learner and deserve a chance. Interviewees need to demonstrate their passion for the job and connect their experiences, professional or not, and knowledge to what the job and company requires.
